meanings.definition: Not having the necessary skills or abilities to do something successfully.
meanings.sent1: The new employee felt incompetent when faced with the complex task.
meanings.sent2: The incompetent chef burned the dinner yet again.
meanings.sent3: The magician's incompetent assistant kept making the rabbit disappear before the trick even started.
meanings.sent4: The team's incompetent defense left the goal wide open for the opponent to score easily.
meanings.sent5: The incompetent driver caused a traffic jam by going the wrong way on a one-way street.

meanings.definition: Failing to meet the required standards or expectations.
meanings.sent1: The student felt incompetent after receiving a failing grade on the test.
meanings.sent2: The incompetent builder's shoddy work led to the building collapsing.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's incompetent joke fell flat with the audience, earning only awkward silence.
meanings.sent4: The politician's incompetent handling of the crisis caused public outrage.
meanings.sent5: The incompetent actor forgot their lines during the crucial scene, ruining the entire play.

meanings.definition: Lacking the necessary qualifications or authority.
meanings.sent1: The incompetent manager struggled to make decisions without proper training.
meanings.sent2: The incompetent referee made a series of bad calls during the game.
meanings.sent3: The incompetent lifeguard fell asleep on duty, missing a swimmer in distress.
meanings.sent4: The incompetent doctor misdiagnosed the patient's condition, leading to further complications.
meanings.sent5: The incompetent pilot got lost during the flight, causing panic among the passengers.
